name: Grand Hotel Duomo

reviews.text: This hotel is probably the best in Pisa.
reviews.title: Don't read the 'septic tank' reviews

reviews.text: A room with a view.
reviews.title: Never stay at the Grand Hotel Duomo!
Disappointing!
reviews.text: A bar, with a barman who can share your angst.

reviews.title: This hotel is utterly appalling
reviews.text: 1 minute walk from the tower.
A bed to sleep and cuddle in, with clean linen. Very comfy bed, too.
reviews.title: A wonderful central hotel would recommend it to everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic , right next to Leaning tower etc. We were able to park just out side for a reasonable cost , not like most places we stayed in Italy. The breakfast was also better than most other hotels in Italy , good choice of cheese, meats , pastries, cereals etc,. Staff friendly and helpful , over all very happy .
reviews.title: Great location , liked hotel

likes.liked: — location , good size bed room and bathroom

reviews.text: Having read the reviews on this site and weighed up the pros and cons, we stayed here for one night on our way back to the UK from San Gimignano. All we were looking for was somewhere reasonable within easy distance of the airport as we had a very early flight to catch the next day. The staff were helpful when we booked in and when we left at 4 a.m. the next day. Our room was very basic but clean and perfectly adequate for our purposes. We could see the leaning tower from our bedroom window and it was a very short walk from the hotel, making it ideal for a quick sight seeing trip. We didn't eat in the hotel because of our early start so i can't comment about the food. All in all, excellent value and a very good location. If you're looking for something luxurious it's not for you but perfectly OK for a short, no frills stay.
reviews.title: Great location, basic rooms

likes.liked: — location - convenient for Leaning Tower and airport

reviews.text: Arrived in Pisa on a Saturday night and checked into this as it was closest to the Leaning Tower. Staff were friendly and we given a large room with two balconies with good views of the tower and catherdral. Air con, tv, fridge and bathroom in good working order.
reviews.title: Not very Grand - but a great location

reviews.text: The hotel is pretty basic, but the location was superb. Pisa is an industrial and ugly city - the only bit you really want to see is the Campo dei Miracoli. At this hotel they are on your doorstep, so you can see the sites in the evening and early morning before the huge crowds and tour parties arrive.
reviews.title: Ignore the bad reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't anything special, but the little trattoria across the street was surprisingly good for such a touristy area.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location

likes.disliked: — curtains could do with a wash

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: All i can say is that some people must be hard to please. We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Duomo. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The Reception area was spotless and welcoming. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean. The sheets and towels were changed every day, and the maids always said good morning with a smile.
The bathroom was out of this world. The bath had a jaccuzi and a power shower which after a long day of walking miles was very welcoming.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Well Worth The Money

reviews.text: We wanted to watch an english football match while were there and had trouble with our television. The staff on reception did everything they could to fix the problem and when they couldnt opened another room for us to watch it in, for which i thank them very much.
reviews.title: Let's tell some truth here
its good
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would certainly choose it again should i ever return to Pisa.

reviews.title: Great Location, Nasty Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is long overdue for a refit. It looks really tired and dated. Staff for the most part were unhelpful. TV in room is old and the remote sometimes worked - probably because it was held together with tape. There was an exceptionally old noisy air conditioner that didn't really produce any cool air so the room was unbearable even late into the evening. The shower was pathetic. Too small and too weak.

reviews.title: Should be Hotel Duomo without the Grand
reviews.text: I highly recommend avoiding this hotel unless you're into 1970's and 80's themed accommodation!

We stayed in this hotel for one night only after arriving late on a Tuesday evening. We waited about 30mins at the airport for a taxi, which then took us to the hotel. The exterior is unremarkable, if not a bit kitch. The interior is old, but tidy and clean. We weren't welcomed particularly friendly: no smiles or words of welcome to Pisa, Italy or the Hotel. Our double room was again old, but nevertheless spacious, clean and had a superb view on the Tower. We were quite hungry by the time we arrived (after 23h00) and luckily still found a Pizzeria open just across the street from the hotel which served pizzas and pastas. The breakfast was good: better than a lot of the other hotels we stayed in whilst in Italy. The greatest plus for this hotel though is it's proximity to the Tower: a few yards and you're there. If you're only in Pisa for 1-2 nights, I would recommend this hotel. It surely doesn't look and/or feel 'grand', as the name implies, but if you're just looking for a basic but comfortable stay, this should be sufficient.
reviews.title: Fantastic...!

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on this website we were both wondering what we would find when we arrived...It was FANTASTIC..!
reviews.title: Roberto a star
Give this one a miss!
reviews.text: We took a taxi from the airport (€10) and arrived at about 2.00pm. Checking in was done in a flash and we were helped with our luggage to our room by a very nice chap, who didn’t even wait for a tip.! Our room was cool and spotlessly clean. The bathroom had marble throughout and the hairdryer was much better than my travel dryer. The shutters to both windows are great for a lie-in in the morning. There is a safe, which you set the code yourself and is completely free – excellent idea for keeping your passports and money in. There is also a mini bar fridge that we stocked up with our own wine purchased from the local PAMS supermarket. On this note, just ask Roberto where this is…(5 minutes past the tower…Italy’s version of ASDA.)
My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night in July.. and 1 night is really the max you need to see the "sights of Pisa".
reviews.title: Great location and adequate facilities

likes.disliked: — receptionist wasn't very helpful and didn't understand much

reviews.text: Courteous and helpful staff. Good value for money considering its proximity to the tower.
reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
Can't fault the location
reviews.text: Just back from Pisa area-stayed one night in this hotel and got exactly what we wanted with regards to room/view/food and service.

reviews.title: Let's hear it for the Grand
reviews.text: Alittle tired yes but what do you want for the money?Location was perfect for exploring the town and would certainly stay there again if we were in town.Value for money being the main force behind that statement.Thanks

The hotel is very close to the tower and we had a great view of it from our balcony. The hotel has seen better days but for the price I managed to get it for from Thomas Cook.com I couldn't fault it for the one night we spent there.
reviews.title: Never again...

likes.disliked: — It's just an old outdated hotel !

description: Contemporary 4-story Hotel situated in tourist center of town, near Leaning Tower.
